t: John 7
After*p these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.
Now*p the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.
His*p brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
For*p there is no man that doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.
For*p neither did his brethren believe in him.
Then*p Jesus said unto them, My*r time*r is*r not*r yet*r come:*r but*r your*r time*r is*r alway*r ready.*r
The*rp world*r cannot*r hate*r you;*r but*r me*r it*r hateth,*r because*r I*r testify*r of*r it,*r that*r the*r works*r thereof*r are*r evil.*r
Go*rp ye*r up*r unto*r this*r feast:*r I*r go*r not*r up*r yet*r unto*r this*r feast;*r for*r my*r time*r is*r not*r yet*r full*r come.*r
When*p he had said these words unto them, he abode still in Galilee.
But*p when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
Then*p the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?
And*p there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.
Howbeit*p no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
Now*p about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
And*p the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
Jesus*p answered them, and said, My*r doctrine*r is*r not*r mine,*r but*r his*r that*r sent*r me.*r
If*rp any*r man*r will*r do*r his*r will,*r he*r shall*r know*r of*r the*r doctrine,*r whether*r it*r be*r of*r God,*r or*r whether*r I*r speak*r of*r myself.*r

He*rp that*r speaketh*r of*r himself*r seeketh*r his*r own*r glory:*r but*r he*r that*r seeketh*r his*r glory*r that*r sent*r him,*r the*r same*r is*r true,*r and*r no*r unrighteousness*r is*r in*r him.*r
Did*rp not*r Moses*r give*r you*r the*r law,*r and*r yet*r none*r of*r you*r keepeth*r the*r law?*r Why*r go*r ye*r about*r to*r kill*r me?*r
The*p people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?
Jesus*p answered and said unto them, I*r have*r done*r one*r work,*r and*r ye*r all*r marvel.*r
Moses*rp therefore*r gave*r unto*r you*r circumcision;*r (not*r because*r it*r is*r of*r Moses,*r but*r of*r the*r fathers;)*r and*r ye*r on*r the*r sabbath*r day*r circumcise*r a*r man.*r

If*rp a*r man*r on*r the*r sabbath*r day*r receive*r circumcision,*r that*r the*r law*r of*r Moses*r should*r not*r be*r broken;*r are*r ye*r angry*r at*r me,*r because*r I*r have*r made*r a*r man*r every*r whit*r whole*r on*r the*r sabbath*r day?*r
Judge*rp not*r according*r to*r the*r appearance,*r but*r judge*r righteous*r judgment.*r
Then*p said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?
But,*p lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
Howbeit*p we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

Then*p cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye*r both*r know*r me,*r and*r ye*r know*r whence*r I*r am:*r and*r I*r am*r not*r come*r of*r myself,*r but*r he*r that*r sent*r me*r is*r true,*r whom*r ye*r know*r not.*r
But*rp I*r know*r him:*r for*r I*r am*r from*r him,*r and*r he*r hath*r sent*r me.*r
Then*p they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.
And*p many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done?
The*p Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.
Then*p said Jesus unto them, Yet*r a*r little*r while*r am*r I*r with*r you,*r and*r then*r I*r go*r unto*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r
Ye*rp shall*r seek*r me,*r and*r shall*r not*r find*r me:*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r thither*r ye*r cannot*r come.*r
Then*p said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?
What*p manner of saying is this that he said, Ye*r shall*r seek*r me,*r and*r shall*r not*r find*r me:*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r thither*r ye*r cannot*r come?*r
In*p the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If*r any*r man*r thirst,*r let*r him*r come*r unto*r me,*r and*r drink.*r
He*rp that*r believeth*r on*r me,*r as*r the*r scripture*r hath*r said,*r out*r of*r his*r belly*r shall*r flow*r rivers*r of*r living*r water.*r
(But*p this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet given; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)
Many*p of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.
Others*p said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?
Hath*p not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?
So*p there was a division among the people because of him.
And*p some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.
Then*p came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?
The*p officers answered, Never man spake like this man.
Then*p answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?
Have*p any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?
But*p this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.
Nicodemus*p saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)
Doth*p our law judge any man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?
They*p answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.
And*p every man went unto his own house.
